subject: Re: [junit] GUI unit testing
msgSnippet: ... We once had a test that compared to images, showing the same graphic at different resolutions (and therefore sizes). It failed when, say, a line was dotted
messageBody:
Altman, Joel G. (JSC-CC)[LM] schrieb:
> One senior developer to whom I gave the task of developing the graphical
> portion of the user interface says there is no way to use JUnit on his
> code. I believe it can be done, but I haven't found anything in JUnit
> Recipes I can use to convince him.
>
> Can somebody give me ammunition for this task? What would be the best
> method for unit testing graphics code?
>
We once had a test that compared to images, showing the same graphic at
different resolutions (and therefore sizes). It failed when, say, a line
was dotted in one, but not in the other image, but passed despite subtle
differences in font size and placement.


What kind of graphics code is the developer producing?

Curious, Ilja
